segment.source: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule (Windows 10)
segment.target: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to specify which apps can or cannot run as exceptions to an AppLocker rule.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to specify which apps can or cannot run as exceptions to an AppLocker rule.

segment.source: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule
segment.target: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to specify which apps can or cannot run as exceptions to an AppLocker rule.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to specify which apps can or cannot run as exceptions to an AppLocker rule.

segment.source: Rule exceptions allow you to specify files or folders to exclude from the rule.
segment.target: Rule exceptions allow you to specify files or folders to exclude from the rule.

segment.source: For more information about exceptions, see Understanding AppLocker rule exceptions.
segment.target: For more information about exceptions, see Understanding AppLocker rule exceptions.

segment.source: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.
segment.target: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.

segment.source: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.
segment.target: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.

segment.source: To configure exceptions for a rule
segment.target: To configure exceptions for a rule

segment.source: Expand the rule collection, right-click the rule that you want to configure exceptions for, and then click Properties.
segment.target: Expand the rule collection, right-click the rule that you want to configure exceptions for, and then click Properties.

segment.source: In the Add exception box, select the rule type that you want to create, and then click Add.
segment.target: In the Add exception box, select the rule type that you want to create, and then click Add.

segment.source: For a publisher exception, click Browse, select the file that contains the publisher to exclude, and then click OK.
segment.target: For a publisher exception, click Browse, select the file that contains the publisher to exclude, and then click OK.

segment.source: For a path exception, choose the file or folder path to exclude, and then click OK.
segment.target: For a path exception, choose the file or folder path to exclude, and then click OK.

segment.source: For a file hash exception, edit the file hash rule, and click Remove.
segment.target: For a file hash exception, edit the file hash rule, and click Remove.

segment.source: For a packaged apps exception, click Add to create the exceptions based on reference app and rule scope.
segment.target: For a packaged apps exception, click Add to create the exceptions based on reference app and rule scope.
